t: Psalm 90
Book Four
From Everlasting to Everlasting
A Prayer of Moses, the man of God.
Lord,*pn you have been our dwelling place in*ld all generations.
Before*ln the mountains were brought forth, or*ld ever you had formed the earth and the world, from*ld everlasting to everlasting you are God.
You*pn return man to dust and*ld say, “Return, O children of man!”
For*ln a thousand years in your sight are*ld but as yesterday when it is past, or*ld as a watch in the night.
You*pn sweep them away as with a flood; they are like a dream, like*ld grass that is renewed in the morning:
in*ln the morning it flourishes and is renewed; in*ld the evening it fades and withers.
For*pn we are brought to an end by your anger; by*ld your wrath we are dismayed.
You*ln have set our iniquities before you, our*ld secret sins in the light of your presence.
For*pn all our days pass away under your wrath; we*ld bring our years to an end like a sigh.
The*ln years of our life are seventy, or*ld even by reason of strength eighty; yet*ln their span is but toil and trouble; they*ld are soon gone, and we fly away.
Who*ln considers the power of your anger, and*ld your wrath according to the fear of you?
So*pn teach us to number our days that*ld we may get a heart of wisdom.
Return,*ln O Lord!*s How long? Have*ld pity on your servants!
Satisfy*ln us in the morning with your steadfast love, that*ld we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
Make*ln us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, and*ld for as many years as we have seen evil.
Let*ln your work be shown to your servants, and*ld your glorious power to their children.
Let*ln the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and*ld establish the work of our hands upon us; yes,*ld establish the work of our hands!
